business.headline: Explained: Why India Cements share price surged 11% today Shares of India Cements rose after UltraTech Cement received a crucial approval from the Competition Commission of India (CCI).
Vivad Se Vishwas Scheme 2024: What is it and how to avail it?Settle tax disputes easily under the Vivad Se Vishwas Scheme 2024 by paying the disputed tax and avoiding penalties.
Sensex jumps 800 points: 3 factors behind today's stock market rallyThe S&P BSE Sensex climbed 802.66 points to 78,844.25 by 11:06 am, while the NSE Nifty50 advanced 243 points to trade at 23,828.60.

Concord Enviro IPO closes for bidding: Check latest subscription, GMP The Concord Enviro IPO is a book-built issue worth Rs 500.33 crore. It consists of a fresh issue of 25 lakh shares, which will raise Rs 175 crore, and an offer for sale (OFS) of 46 lakh shares valued at Rs 325.33 crore.

Stocks to watch today: Zomato, RIL, TCS, Vedanta, NTPC Green, Ultratech CementBoth the BSE Sensex and NSE Nifty50 witnessed massive losses last week, with the Sensex dropping over 4,000 points across five consecutive sessions and the Nifty falling by nearly 1,200 points, marking a 5% weekly loss.

Unimech Aerospace IPO opens: Check opening date, gmp, price band, lot size Unimech Aerospace IPO: The price band for the IPO has been set at Rs 745 to Rs 785 per share. The minimum lot size for investors is 19 shares, which requires a minimum investment of Rs 14,915.

Dam Capital Advisors IPO: Check GMP as listing enters last day for bidding Dam Capital Advisors IPO is a book-built issue worth Rs 840.25 crore. The entire issue is an Offer for Sale (OFS) of 2.97 crore shares by the selling shareholders, meaning the company will not receive any funds from this offering.
Sensex, Nifty snap losing streak with IT, metal surge; RIL shares up over 1%The S&P BSE Sensex was up 577.72 points to 78,619.31, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 185.80 points to 23,773.30.

Zomato shares to be in focus today. Here's why Zomato's stock has surged nearly 43% over the last six months and approximately 126% over the past year, far outpacing the Sensex's one-year return of 10.7%.

Epigamia co-founder Rohan Mirchandani dies at 42 due to cardiac arrestRohan Mirchandani, co-founder of Epigamia, died due to cardiac arrest. Known for transforming India's food market, he led Epigamia's growth to over 20,000 retail outlets in 30 cities.

GST Council's key decisions: What's cheaper, what's costlier, and all other detailsGST Council brings key tax changes impacting everyday essentials like popcorn, used cars, fortified rice, corporate sponsorships, and penalties.

GST at 18% on used EV car sale by business, jet fuel stays out of its ambitThe GST Council in its 55th meeting also decided to clarify on taxability of popcorn, saying caramelised popcorn will continue to attract tax at the rate of 18 per cent.

GST Council delays decision on lowering tax for health, life insurance premiumsGST Council Meeting: During the 55th meeting held on Saturday, technical considerations led to the deferral, with the Group of Ministers (GoM) tasked to conduct further deliberations.

GST Council Meeting: Will tax rates on health and life insurance premiums drop today? GST Council Meeting begins: One of the key items on the agenda is the proposal to reduce the Goods and Services Tax (GST) on insurance premiums, a move that could bring relief to policyholders.

55th GST Council Meeting begins: What could become costlier or cheaper todayGST Council Meeting: From essential services to luxury items, a wide range of proposals are under discussion, some of which could significantly impact consumers and businesses.

Explained: Why Sensex fell 4,000 points in 5 trading sessionsThe BSE Sensex plummeted over 4,000 points across five consecutive sessions, while the NSE Nifty50 fell approximately 1,200 points, representing a nearly 5% loss within the week.

Vivad Se Vishwas Scheme: FAQs for settling tax disputes easily Taxpayers can resolve pending income tax disputes under the Direct Tax Vivad Se Vishwas Scheme 2024 by settling the disputed tax amount and avoiding additional interest and penalties.

Nita Ambani to headline India Conference at HarvardThe India Conference at Harvard, one of the largest student-led India-focused events in the US, is hosted by students across Harvard's graduate and undergraduate schools.

Sensex nosedives 1,100 points, Nifty falls below 23,600; IT stocks tumbleStock market crash: The S&P BSE Sensex ended 1,176.46 points lower at 78,041.59, while the NSE Nifty50 settled 364.20 points lower at 23,587.50.
Paytm Money launches 'Pay Later' Margin Trading. 3 things to knowPaytm Money launches 'Pay Later' MTF, democratising stock trading with seamless activation, innovative tools, and affordable rates.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Accused in Allu Arjun house attack get bail, Revanth Reddy link emergesBRS leader Krishank has claimed that one of the six accused, who got bail in actor Allu Arjun's house attack case, was an "aide" of Telangana Chief Minister Revanth Reddy.

Manu Bhaker, double Olympic medalist, not in Khel Ratna nominees list: SourcesManu Bhaker, who won two bronze medals in the Paris Olympics earlier this year, won't be getting the Khel Ratna award. Her father Ramkrishna Bhasker was disappointed after the committee did not recommend her name.

3 Khalistani terrorists, who attacked Punjab Police post, killed in UP encounterThree terrorists belonging to Khalistan Commando Force were killed in an encounter in Uttar Pradesh. The police also seized two AK-47 rifles and two pistols from their custody.

After Panama Canal, Trump now wants US to buy Greenland: 'Absolute necessity'Donald Trump's renewed interest in Greenland is not new as the US President-elect had made his desire known to control the territory during his first term from 2017 to 2021.

With 85 Sharia courts, UK becomes western capital for Islamic rulingsBritain is now home to 85 sharia courts that rule on family matters of marriage and divorce. With Muslims from North America and Europe coming to appeal to these Islamic councils, Britain is emerging as the "western capital" for sharia courts. Organisations are expressing concern.

Kumar Vishwas invokes Ramayana in veiled dig at Shatrughan Sinha, stokes rowPoet Kumar Vishwas faced backlash for a veiled jibe at Shatrughan Sinha and Sonakshi Sinha over her interfaith marriage.  with Congress leaders condemning his remarks as "cheap" and "lewd."

Bashar al-Assad's wife files for divorce, unhappy with life in Moscow: ReportDeposed Syrian President Bashar al-Assad's wife Asma al-Assad has expressed her dissatisfaction with her life in Moscow following her husband's ouster from power by rebels.

Man registers Sunny Leone's name for Chhattisgarh scheme, gets Rs 1,000 monthlyA man fraudulently registered actor Sunny Leone as a beneficiary under a government scheme providing Rs 1,000 per month to economically weaker married women.
18% GST on caramelised popcorn sparks meme fest online. Best ones hereSocial media memes flooded the internet after the GST Council confirmed that caramelised popcorn would attract an 18% tax.

Flyers say booze ran out on debut Air India Surat-Bangkok flight, officials denyAir India's inaugural Surat-Bangkok flight saw good sales of liquor onboard, but some passengers claimed the stock ran out.

Madhya Pradesh man dies in accident, wife's 'preserve sperm' plea stumps doctorsA grieving woman in Madhya Pradesh's Rewa requested her late husband's sperm preservation to conceive his child, but doctors denied it as over 24 hours had passed since his death.

Car ratings are crucial, but always follow these 6 rules to be safe on roadA high safety rating in a crash test does not make a car indestructible.

Chess star Tania Sachdev calls out Delhi government for lack of support to sport Tania Sachdev claimed she has not been recognised by the Delhi government for her role in India's historic win in Budapest earlier this year. Tania was also part of the bronze medal-winning women's team at the 2022 Olympiad in Chennai.

How Bengal Police rescued kidnapped girl, 7, in less than 5 hoursThe Bengal Police rescued a minor girl, who was kidnapped from outside her home in Malda after a four-and-a-half-hour operation. Two accused have been arrested in connection with the case.

Video of Illuminati Dance Crew's performance at IIT Bombay's tech fest goes viralA video of a mesmerising dance performance by the Illuminati Dance Crew at IIT Bombay's 2024 tech fest has gone viral on social media.
Isro is launching a robotic arm with Spadex in spaceThe SpaDEX mission consists of two satellites, Chaser and Target, each weighing around 220 kg.

Monali Thakur walks out of concert due to mismanagement: Everything was a messSinger Monali Thakur abruptly ended her concert in Varanasi on Sunday due to mismanagement. Apologising to her fans, she criticised the event organisers for failing to provide adequate facilities.

New Year begins on Mars, but it's not as festive as EarthThe beginning of a new year is marked by the onset of spring in the northern hemisphere of the Red Planet, leading to an active and explosive thaw.

Are we in Delhi or MCG? Usman Khawaja on massive support for India on Boxing DayThe MCG is set for an electrifying Boxing Day Test, but with Indian fans expected to dominate the stands, Usman Khawaja's humorous question lingers: 'Are we in Delhi or MCG?' The stage is set for cricketing fireworks.

2 months, 6 ODI debuts: India continue experimenting with eyes on World CupINDW vs WIW: India have gone into an experimentation mode since crashing out of the Women's T20 World Cup back in October. Seven players have made debuts for them in international cricket, six of them are in ODIs.

Watch: Flying Harmanpreet Kaur takes stunning one-handed catch in 1st ODIHarmanpreet Kaur picked a stunning one-handed catch in the 1st ODI between India and West Indies women. Her screamer of a catch left the crowd and her team in awe of the captain.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
